title: Gobert slams teammates for 'unacceptable' effort
content: Timberwolves center Rudy Gobert called out his after a loss to the Pelicans and challenged the coaching staff to bench players not giving enough effort.

title: Syracuse's Autry: My call to bench Anthony in loss
content: Syracuse coach Adrian Autry said it was his call to bench Kiyan Anthony, who isn't injured and was available to play, for his team's entire 72-59 loss at No. 18 Virginia on Saturday.

title: Knight ties U.S. Olympic goal mark in rout of Finns
content: Hilary Knight scored to tie the U.S. Olympic women's hockey career goal record, and the Americans wore down a Finland opponent that spent much of the week dealing with a stomach virus in a 5-0 win at the Milan Cortina Games on Saturday.

title: Sources: Falcons to cut Cousins before key date
content: Falcons QB Kirk Cousins is expected to be released before the start of the new league year in March, sources told ESPN.

title: Shooting Stars contest sees NBA All-Star return
content: After an 11-year hiatus, the NBA is bringing back the Shooting Stars competition. The All-Star Saturday night contest will feature four teams made up of two current NBA players and one retired player.

title: Von Allmen wins downhill, 1st gold of Milan Cortina
content: Swiss racer Franjo von Allmen captured the Olympic downhill Saturday to win the first gold medal at the Milan Cortina Games.

title: Speedskater Lollobrigida wins host Italy's 1st gold
content: Speedskater Francesca Lollobrigida won host Italy's first gold medal of the Milan Cortina Games on Saturday, taking the women's 3,000 meters in an Olympics-record time.

content: YAC, air yards, fastest player speed. Seth Walder looks at Next Gen Stats props and names his top overall play.

content: Kobbie Mainoo looked on his way out of Manchester United as they struggled under Ruben Amorim. Now he's pivotal in their revival under Michael Carrick.

title: An intradivision swap? Houston making moves? MLB trade proposals that could shake up the start of spring training
content: Who has too many players at one position? Who has a big hole to fill? We found the biggest and propose deals to fix the imbalances.

content: From more outrage over big spending to the deals that never happened, here's what we learned this winter.

title: No Spanish? No problem: Bad Bunny promises a party at halftime
content: Ahead of Sunday's halftime show, Bad Bunny reassured fans that his performance is meant to be felt, not translated.

title: The best of the 2026 recruiting class, by position
content: How elite are the Nos. 1 and 2 recruits in the 2026 class? We analyze each position and break down who can be sleepers.

title: Reid's updated NFL draft rankings: Who jumped up the board after the Senior Bowl?
content: Jordan Reid ranked the top 50 players in the 2026 NFL draft class, including scouting reports and standouts at every position.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Inter Milan target USMNT's Weston McKennie
content: Inter Milan and multiple MLS clubs are hoping to sign Weston McKennie this summer. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: From AD and Harden to Zubac and Vucevic: Fantasy reaction to the latest NBA trades
content: Andre Snellings and Eric Moody provide fantasy reactions as trades go down leading up to Thursday's NBA trade deadline.

title: NDTV Profit Conclave 2026: LCA Tejas Won't Become Dated. Defence Secretary Explains Why
content: The Indian Air Force (IAF) has placed a large order for 180 Light Combat Aircraft (LCA) Tejas. However, some have speculated that by the time the IAF gets all the aircraft it had ordered, these platforms would become dated.

title: Over 70 School Children Fall Ill After Eating Mid-Day Meal In Bihar
content: More than 70 schoolchildren fell ill after consuming the mid-day meal at an Upgraded Middle School in Karu Tola at Sahugarh under Madhepura Sadar block of Bihar on Saturday, triggering panic among teachers, parents and locals.

title: 'Indian Consulate Will Open In Malaysia, Bring Our Nations Closer': PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday announced that an Indian Consulate will also be opened soon in Malaysia, bringing the two nations even closer.

title: Delhi Traffic Police Tests Laser Speed Guns To Boost Enforcement
content: Delhi Traffic Police has intensified speed enforcement measures along the NH-44 corridor by conducting trials of handheld laser speed guns at the Libaspur Bus Stand area, officials said on Saturday.

title: All About Muhammad Yunus, The Nobel Laureate Leading Bangladesh's Interim Government
content: He was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 2006 for his efforts to combat poverty and promote economic and social development from the grassroots.

title: UP Man Arrested While Leaving For Honeymoon After Evading Cops At Wedding
content: An accused, wanted in connection with an alleged assault and vandalism incident at a hotel here, was arrested from Maharashtra's Satara district while leaving on a honeymoon with his newly-wed wife, an official said on Saturday.

title: Many Feared Trapped After 3-Storey Building Collapses In Rajasthan's Kota
content: A three-storey building collapsed in Rajasthan's Kota on Saturday night, sparking fears that several people may be trapped under the debris, an official said.

title: Delhi's Mayur Vihar Pocket 1 Metro Station Renamed Shri Ram Mandir Mayur Vihar
content: The Mayur Vihar Pocket 1 Metro Station in East Delhi has been renamed Shri Ram Mandir Mayur Vihar, following a long-standing demand from locals and the community, an official said on Saturday.

title: Blanket, Disproportionate Freezing Of Bank Accounts Arbitrary: Delhi High Court
content: Blanket or disproportionate freezing of bank accounts, when the account holder is neither an accused nor a suspect in an investigation, is manifestly arbitrary and against one's fundamental right to livelihood, the Delhi High Court has said.

title: Gangster Joga Pholriwal Among 4 Charged For AAP Leader's Murder In Jalandhar
content: Punjab Police have registered a case against two named persons, including a foreign-based gangster, and two unknown individuals in connection with the daylight murder of AAP leader Lucky Oberoi in Jalandhar on Friday

title: 4 Indian Students Injured After Knife Attack In Russian College: Embassy
content: Four Indian students were among several people who were injured in an attack in Russia's Ufa, the Indian embassy in Moscow said in a post on X.

title: US Attacks Venezuela Highlights: Shots Fired, Drones Fly Over Venezuela Presidential Palace
content: US-Venezuela Conflict Highlights: Unidentified drones flew over the Miraflores palace in central Caracas and security forces opened fire in response around 8 pm (0000 GMT), the source said.

title: How Shoes Led To Arrest Of Businessman-Turned-Chain Snatcher In Mumbai
content: A single individual has been identified as the mastermind behind a series of chain-snatching incidents that recently hit Mumbai and Navi Mumbai. Police have arrested 49-year-old Mohan Kokate, a resident of Mumbai's Sion area.

title: Video Shows Prisoner Tied To Tree, Thrashed By Cop In Madhya Pradesh
content: A chilling video allegedly shot inside a jail in Madhya Pradesh has exploded across social media, exposing what appears to be a shocking case of custodial brutality.

title: Netanyahu To Meet Trump In US On Monday To Discuss Negotiations With Iran
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is expected to meet U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday in Washington, where they will discuss negotiations with Iran, Netanyahu's office said on Saturday.

title: French Ex-Minister Offers Resignation From Paris Cultural Hub Over Epstein Links
content: Former French culture minister Jack Lang offered his resignation Saturday from his role as head of a prestigious Paris cultural centre over his links to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, in a letter to the foreign minister seen by AFP.

title: 'India's Success Is Success Of Malaysia, Asia': PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday underscored the depth of India-Malaysia ties, saying that India's success is intrinsically linked with Malaysia's success and, in turn, Asia's success.

title: China Conducted Nuclear Tests A Week After Galwan Clash In 2020: US
content: China conducted secret nuclear explosive tests using a method to decrease the effectiveness of seismic monitoring, US Under Secretary of State Thomas G DiNanno said.

title: 'Boeing Looking At India As Largest Parts Manufacturer': Minister On US Deal
content: US-based Boeing is a large buyer of aircraft parts from India and is looking at the country as its largest foreign original equipment manufacturer (OEM) base for components going forward, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said on Saturday.

title: Salman Khan Attends Mohan Bhagwat's Speech At RSS Centenary Event
content: RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat on Saturday made a strong push for a "Swadeshi" economic model, saying that while global interdependence is a reality, it must be voluntary and free of pressure, rather than a result of trade wars or tariff-driven compulsions.

title: Why is Dreamliner‚Äôs fuel system under watch? | Explained
content: What happened on a recent Air India flight? Why are certain fuel control switches malfunctioning? Weren‚Äôt precautionary checks undertaken after the Ahmedabad mishap in June last year? What is the risk it poses to the engine when switches are faulty?

title: Stephen Miller | The anti-immigration czar
content: The U.S. Homeland Security Adviser has shaped President Donald Trump‚Äôs most inflammatory immigration initiatives

title: Purnea MP arrested in 31-year-old case, sent to two-day judicial custody
content: Opposition leaders criticise late-night action against Pappu Yadav, who has been highlighting the alleged death and rape of a medical aspirant in Patna; court to hear bail plea tomorrow

title: Yumnam Khemchand Singh | Crisis-time CM
content: The new BJP Chief Minister of Manipur has to take measures to heal the ethnic wounds while navigating administrative challenges

title: Zaman S. Khan wins Kochi round of The Hindu BusinessLine Cerebration Corporate Quiz 2026
content: Khan will now represent Kochi at the grand finale scheduled to be held at the BSE, Mumbai, on February 21

title: Police Inspector killed, 13 injured after swing collapses at Surajkund Mela in Faridabad
content: Haryana Tourism Minister Arvind Sharma, who visited the accident spot, said that directions were issued for a thorough investigation of the entire incident and assured strict action against the culprits

title: Forgetting Hindu sentiments led to Partition: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
content: ‚ÄúWe said we respect all religions because we are Hindus. There are people who say this was wrong. Islam and Christianity still exist in India. There are skirmishes, but the country has remained united,‚Äù says Bhagwat

title: Sabari rail: govt. steps rekindle hopes among people along proposed corridor
content: The project is on the right track, with the State govt. deciding to bear 50% of the cost, including land acquisition expenses, and the Railway Ministry de-freezing the project, say officials

title: Two dead, several feared trapped as three-storey building collapses in Rajasthan‚Äôs Kota
content: Local MLA Sandeep Sharma, who reached the spot soon after the incident, said the building collapsed suddenly and there was a possibility that more people were trapped under the debris

title: SIR woes continue on the last day of hearing in West Bengal
content: The Trinamool Congress highlights the plight of people, including incidents such as death of two people on the way to the hearing centre. The BJP alleges ‚Äòhooliganism‚Äô by the ruling party at the hearing centres.

title: People raised in State-run orphanages and charity homes struggle with SIR rules on parent mapping
content: ECI officials have said orphanage‚Äôs name should be entered in the column for parents, but lack of specific guidelines leads to chaos on the ground; with no lineage proof, State must provide needed documentation

title: Ram Madhav‚Äôs first meeting hints at BJP high command-driven campaign for GBA polls; MLAs upset
content: Madhav suggests that polls in each of the five corporations will be held under a ‚Äòprabhari‚Äô from the party, to ensure accountability

title: BJP claims Union govt. has put metro fare hike on hold; BMRCL says no such direction
content: We can decide only when official communication comes to us. So far, we have not received any communication, says a BMRCL official

title: Samyukt Kisan Morcha demands Goyal‚Äôs resignation, asks PM to refrain from signing deal with U.S.
content: The leaders of SKM said the framework for the interim agreement on U.S.-India trade is a total surrender before the multinational giants of U.S. agriculture sector; they urged farmers to join protest demonstrations on February 12 and support the general strike of workers as a ‚Äòbefitting reply to the anti-people Modi government‚Äô

title: Public representatives to cast vote as ex-officio members as per Division Bench verdict: HC
content: Petition was filed in a premature stage since it was based on news reports, Additional Advocate General told the court

title: West Bengal CEO seeks one-week extension for SIR deadline; 5%¬†hearings pending
content: If the extention approved, officials say the publication of the final rolls could be pushed to February 21¬†

title: Karnataka High Court confirms death penalty for three men in gang rape and murder of minor
content: The court has declared that the 2021 crime against a girl aged around eight was ‚Äòrarest of rare‚Äô cases ¬†

title: AAP leader murder case: One arrested after exchange of fire in Amritsar, says Punjab Police
content: The accused, identified as Shaminder Singh, a resident of Mithapur in Jalandhar, was arrested following a brief exchange of fire in the Khasa area of Amritsar, they added.

title: Tadoba tiger‚Äôs conduct, health meet NTCA protocol for rehabilitation in natural habitat
content: The tiger didn‚Äôt attack any humans or suffer any injury during its 650-km walk in various landscapes,¬†criteria for a tranquilised tiger‚Äôs release into a suitable habitat with an adequate prey base

title: Congress questions Uttar Pradesh BJP chief for holding dual roles, calls ‚Äòone person, one post‚Äô a farce
content: Stating that the Bharatiya Janata Party‚Äôs U.P. unit chief Pankaj Chaudhary holds dual positions as Union Minister of State and the U.P. BJP president, Congress says such tall claims have nothing to do with reality

title: Amaravati will be among world‚Äôs top quantum hubs, says Lokesh
content: Amaravati Quantum Valley will create large-scale, high-quality, and future-ready jobs for the youth, asserts the IT Minister

title: Kerala rights panel seeks report on mahout killed by jumbo at elephant rehabilitation centre in Kottoor
content: Panel seeks to know whether any preventive measures have been taken to ensure such an incident does not recur

title: Cochin Cancer Research Centre to be inaugurated on February 9
content: Located within the Kalamassery Medical College campus, the CCRC will provide advanced, high-quality cancer care, marking a significant milestone in Kerala‚Äôs efforts to establish the best of cancer treatment and research in the State

title: Three declared foreigners in Assam ordered to leave India
content: The Karbi Anglong district authorities instructed them to exit via Dhubri, Sribhumi or South Salmara-Mankachar districts, bordering Bangladesh

title: Resonance Educational Institutions launches new campus in Kurnool
content: IIT JEE and NEET coaching major expands footprint in Rayalaseema with schools and colleges offering CBSE and integrated programmes

title: Centre has significantly increased allocations for Kerala in Union Budget: Nitin Nabin
content: BJP president highlights higher tax share, doubled grants and infrastructure push while addressing Budget discussion in Thrissur. Benefits for agricultural sectors such as cashew and cocoa would reach Kerala, he says.

title: Manmohan Singh govt.‚Äôs plan to relocate Dal Lake dwellers shelved; families to stay on the lake
content: The plan to relocate about 9,000 families achieved ‚Äúonly 27%¬†progress‚Äù in 17 years, the J&K government tells Assembly; only 1,808 families were resettled, say officials

title: Ten years of BRS loot will be etched in State‚Äôs annals: CM Revanth Reddy
content: He recalled that former IPS officer R.S. Praveen Kumar had himself spoken about a fake currency case involving KCR

title: Amaravati Quantum Valley a game-changing initiative, says Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: It symbolises the creation of a strong base of global talent that will drive the quantum transition in the decades to come and place India at the forefront of the global revolution, he says

title: Girls leading in UG medical admissions in Andhra Pradesh, says report
content: Girls have secured 60.72% of the total MBBS seats, while the same for dental and AYUSH programmes fall between 76.17% and 85%

title: Gang rape at Ayurvedic spa in Thiruvalla: police form SIT
content: Police record statements of both survivor and spa owner and an inquiry is also under way to ascertain whether the spa was involved in any illegal activities

title: Stir against Baldota steel plant in Koppal completes 100 days
content: Panditaradhya Shivacharya Swamy of Sanehalli Mutt calls for election boycott to pressure government to withdraw the proposed steel plant

title: Srisailam temple readies for Mahasivaratri with special darshan arrangements
content: All arjitha and paroksha sevas cancelled during the 11-day festivities; separate queue lines, water facilities and free laddu prasadams arranged for devotees

title: Airport buses to stop at all Bengaluru metro stations along the route
content: Earlier, airport buses stopped only at designated BMTC bus stops, many of which were located far from metro stations

title: Five cubs born to Namibian cheetah at Madhya Pradesh‚Äôs Kuno National Park; population rises to 35
content: Project Cheetah, India‚Äôs cheetah reintroduction programme was kickstarted on September 17, 2022, with Mr. Modi releasing eight¬†Cheetahs, translocated from Namibia, at Kuno

title: 51 Maoists surrender in Sukma, Bijapur
content: Of them, 30 surrender in Bijapur, while 21 surrender in Sukma; in Sukma, where 21 cadres have returned to the mainstream, the Naxalite organisation suffers a major setback

title: India-US trade deal: What it means for farmers, entrepreneurs and the 'Make in India' push
content: India-US trade deal: India and the US have released a joint statement detailing the broad contours of the trade agreement that is expected to be signed in a few weeks. The trade deal is a big boost for India's exports. We decode the benefits:

title: Ahead of Macron‚Äôs visit, DAC likely to meet next week to approve deal for 114 Rafales
content: India's Defence Acquisition Council is set to consider a major proposal to purchase 114 Rafale fighter jets from France for approximately Rs 3.25 lakh crore. This significant procurement, with a substantial portion to be manufactured in India, aims to bolster the Indian Air Force's fighter squadron strength amidst rising regional security concerns.

title: Govt spent barely 40% of Budget on biggest schemes in 9 months
content: Government spending on major schemes lags significantly, with only 41.2% of the budgeted amount disbursed in the first nine months. Revised estimates for 47 out of 53 large projects are lower than initially planned. Several key initiatives, including the Jal Jeevan Mission, show drastically reduced spending, raising concerns about project execution and fund utilization.

title: Trust has become India's strongest currency: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi highlighted recent trade agreements with the US and other nations as proof of growing global trust in India. He emphasized the country's shift from a mere market to an investment and trade hub, fostering 'Make in India' and creating jobs. These deals, he stated, reflect a dynamic partnership and commitment to innovation and shared prosperity.

title: 'Politically motivated': Sonia Gandhi slams plea over 1980 voter list inclusion
content: Sonia Gandhi Saturday termed a criminal revision petition against a magisterial order as "politically motivated and frivolous." The petition alleges her name was included in electoral rolls in 1980 using forged documents, despite her acquiring Indian citizenship later. Gandhi argued citizenship and electoral roll issues fall outside criminal court jurisdiction.

title: SpaceX 'hiring problem': Elon Musk says engineers not ready to relocate
content: SpaceX faces a significant hurdle in attracting engineers and technicians to its Starbase facility in South Texas due to limited job prospects for their spouses. Elon Musk highlighted this 'significant other' problem, noting the remote location's scarcity of non-SpaceX employment. This challenge, though less severe, also impacts Tesla's recruitment in Texas, contrasting with easier relocations from California's job-rich areas.

title: Three-storeyed building collapses in Rajasthan's Kota; 2 killed, several feared trapped
content: A three-storey building housing a restaurant collapsed in Kota, Rajasthan, killing at least two people and leaving several others feared trapped. Rescue operations are underway, with five individuals already rescued and hospitalized. The incident occurred in the Talwandi area, and authorities are working to ascertain the full extent of casualties.

title: India, US discuss ways to boost collaboration in critical, emerging defence tech
content: India and the US convened in New Delhi to bolster cooperation in cutting-edge defence technologies. The 24th Indo-US Joint Technical Group Plenary Meeting focused on enhancing joint research and development, involving universities, labs, and industries. Discussions aimed to address evolving defence needs and explore new collaborative avenues, culminating in a project agreement.

title: Tamil literature is eternal and its culture global, PM Modi says in Malaysia
content: Prime Minister Modi lauded Tamil culture at a Kuala Lumpur event, highlighting its global reach and the significant presence of Tamilians in India's leadership. He announced UPI's upcoming availability in Malaysia and the opening of India's first consulate there, strengthening bilateral ties and community outreach. Modi also pledged a new Thiruvalluvar Centre to honor shared heritage.

title: Elon Musk denies Starlink phone: CEO says no device in works
content: Elon Musk has officially denied reports of SpaceX developing a Starlink phone, stating "We are not developing a phone." This clarification comes amidst speculation about the satellite internet business's expansion ahead of a potential IPO. Musk has previously expressed strong reluctance towards phone manufacturing.

title: ‚ÄòThere was blood all around‚Äô: Knife rampage at Russian university injures four Indians
content: A stabbing attack in Ufa, Russia, injured several people, including four Indian students, the Indian Embassy confirmed. A 15-year-old assailant attacked students in a medical university hostel, also stabbing two police officers before harming himself. The injured have been hospitalized.

title: Over 1.7 crore tourists, including 36,000 foreigners, visited J&K in 2025: Govt
content: Jammu & Kashmir welcomed over 1.7 crore tourists in 2025, including more than 36,000 international visitors. While no specific targets are set for 2026, the government is actively working to boost tourist numbers through various initiatives. The Home Stay program has proven successful and is slated for expansion, despite facing challenges like awareness and infrastructure gaps.

title: Amit Shah reviews development projects, reaffirms Modi govt‚Äôs push for prosperous J&K
content: Union home minister Amit Shah reviewed Jammu and Kashmir's development projects. He also stressed hydropower potential and welfare scheme saturation. Aggressive tourism marketing and sports infrastructure development were highlighted. The region will receive 50-year interest-free loans for capital projects. The government aims for a developed Jammu and Kashmir by 2047.

title: Strategic Forces Command successfully test-fires 3,000 km-range Agni-3 missile
content: India successfully test-fired its nuclear-capable Agni-3 ballistic missile, boasting a 3,000-km range, from Chandipur, Odisha. The surface-to-surface missile, launched from a mobile launcher as part of a regular training exercise, validated all operational and technical parameters. This test reinforces India's robust nuclear deterrent capabilities.

title: BJP mocks NC‚Äôs ‚Äòspecial status‚Äô call for J&K, says no return of Article 370
content: BJP leader Sunil Sharma challenged the National Conference's demand for Jammu and Kashmir's "special status," stating the term is not in the Indian Constitution. Sunil Sharma argued that Article 370, which NC claims defined this status, has been "buried," dismissing the demand as baseless and accusing NC of misleading voters.

title: Top PIO restaurateur found guilty of spiking woman‚Äôs drink at Annabel‚Äôs in Mayfair
content: An Indian-origin restaurateur, owner of Michelin-starred Benares, has been convicted of drugging a woman's cocktail at Annabel's with intent to overpower her for sex. Staff intervened, preventing her from drinking the spiked 'Spicy Margarita' laced with GBL. Police found GBL traces in a vanilla extract bottle and at his home.

title: T20 WC: India survive USA test; register 29-run win with Suryakumar's heroics
content: India secured a 35-run victory against the USA in their T20 World Cup opener. Despite a shaky batting performance, Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 84 guided India to 161. Arshdeep Singh and Mohammed Siraj then dismantled the USA's top order, setting up a comfortable win for the hosts.

title: 'I don't do 50/50': Kayla Nicole opens up on finances with Travis Kelce
content: While Travis Kelce moved on in his life with Taylor Swift, his ex girlfriend, popular social media influencer, Kayla Nicole's controversial statements about how she managed finances while dating the star player have sparked chaos. Over the last few years, Kayla Nicole has also been brutally trolled for allegedly making subtle digs at Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift's high profile relationship.

title: Mavericks vs Spurs injury report: Playing status, head-to-head, stats & more
content: The Dallas Mavericks will play the San Antonio Spurs on February 7, 2026. San Antonio is in strong form while Dallas faces significant injury issues. The Spurs have won both previous meetings this season. Player availability will be crucial in this matchup. This game offers Dallas a chance to gauge progress against a top Western Conference team.

title: MLB trade rumours: Reds tipped to land $10.2m Yankees slugger to boost title odds
content: Cincinnati Reds are eyeing Jazz Chisholm Jr. to bolster their lineup, potentially trading pitcher Brady Singer and infielder Matt McLain. Chisholm offers proven power and speed, addressing the Reds' offensive struggles. The Yankees, seeking pitching depth and infield versatility, might consider the deal to manage future payroll. This move could boost Cincinnati's playoff hopes.

title: Shia Muslims protest in Kashmir over deadly blast at Islamabad mosque
content: Kashmiri Shia Muslims held protests across the region condemning a suicide bombing at a mosque in Islamabad. The attack killed over 30 people during Friday prayers. Demonstrations occurred in Srinagar, Baramulla, and Bandipora. Protesters voiced anger against the Pakistani government and expressed solidarity with the victims. Some raised slogans supporting Syed Hassan Nasrallah, Palestine, and Hezbollah.

title: Congress calls pact a surrender, says something being hidden
content: Congress criticized the India-US trade deal framework as a "surrender," citing concerns over unspecified "additional products" for tariff reductions. Leaders argued the deal is heavily tilted towards the US and will negatively impact farmers, highlighting a lack of transparency in the agreement's details.

title: US deal boosts India's growth engine: Amit Shah
content: India and the United States have reached an interim trade agreement. This deal is expected to boost India's economic growth and manufacturing sector. Government leaders stated that the agreement safeguards the nation's core interests. It aims to create more jobs and opportunities for farmers, entrepreneurs, and businesses across the country.

title: Ofcom revokes TV licences of Overseas Friends of BJP (UK) president
content: UK's Ofcom has revoked broadcasting licences for MATV National and MATV Music, held by Middlesex Broadcasting Corporation Limited. The regulator determined that MATV Broadcasting Ltd, where Kuldeep Shekhawat is a director, exercised editorial control, not the licence holder. Ofcom cited Shekhawat's role as president of Overseas Friends of BJP (UK) as a potential disqualification due to political affiliations.

title: 'Khejri Bachao Andolan': Why Rajasthan is rallying to protect its 'Kalpavriksha'
content: A significant protest is under way in Rajasthan over the felling of the khejri tree. Communities are demanding stronger protection for the state tree, alleging that it is being cut to make way for solar power projects. Political leaders across parties have joined the movement, drawing attention to the tree‚Äôs cultural and ecological significance. In an arid landscape where survival is closely tied to ecology, the debate in western Rajasthan now extends beyond development to questions of history, identity and survival.

title: 1 dead, 13 hurt as fairground ride collapses in Haryana's Surajkund Mela
content: Tragedy struck the Surajkund Mela in Faridabad Saturday evening when a swing ride collapsed, killing a police inspector and injuring thirteen others. The brave officer lost his life attempting to rescue people as the ride tilted. Authorities have vowed swift action against the operator, with an FIR to be registered.

title: 'We could've batted better': SKY makes honest admission after USA win
content: India start their T20 World Cup with a 29-run win over the USA, recovering from 77/6 thanks to captain Suryakumar Yadav‚Äôs unbeaten 84 off 49 balls. SKY admitted, "We could've batted a little better," praising his Mumbai experience and coach Gautam Gambhir‚Äôs advice. Bowlers Siraj, Arshdeep, and Axar restricted the USA to 132/8, securing a hard-fought victory.

title: 557 days of wait: Mohammed Siraj's unexpected T20I World Cup return
content: Mohammed Siraj made an unexpected return to India's T20I side for their World Cup opener against the USA. Called up as standby cover, he was drafted into the playing XI after Jasprit Bumrah fell ill. This marked Siraj's first T20 international appearance in 557 days, a significant moment on the grandest stage.

title: Widowed DIL's maintenance survives FIL's death: Delhi High Court
content: The ruling settles a long-standing interpretative question that has existed long in relation to Sections 19, 21 and 22 of the HAMA and has extensive consequences on widowed women who are left without a means of livelihood after the death of their husband.

title: ‚ÄòIn 36 months, the cheapest place to put AI will be ‚Ä¶‚Äô: Musk makes a bold prediction
content: Elon Musk predicts space will become the most cost-effective location for AI data centers within three years. He cited advantages like five times greater solar panel efficiency, no need for batteries due to constant sunlight, and the absence of atmospheric interference.

title: Villagers still believe U Thlen can shapeshift into any form: A nightmare from Mawsynram
content: During a cold January night in Mawsynram, the narrator learned the chilling legend of U Thlen, a shape-shifting serpent demanding blood sacrifices for wealth.  The story recounts how this malevolent entity, a symbol of greed, was eventually defeated by being tricked into consuming lime, leading to its demise at the now-famous Dainthlen Falls.

title: T20 WC: Romario Shepherd lights-up tournament with hat-trick - Watch
content: Romario Shepherd claimed the inaugural hat-trick of the 2026 T20 World Cup during the West Indies' opening match against Scotland. His crucial wickets in the 17th over significantly hampered Scotland's chase of 182. The West Indies ultimately secured a 35-run victory, with Shimron Hetmyer's 64 contributing to their total.

title: Father's 3 wives & a dead live-in partner: Why Ghaziabad sisters‚Äô suicide is getting murkier
content: Three minor sisters in Ghaziabad died by suicide after their father confiscated their mobile phones due to their obsession with Korean culture. Investigations revealed the girls were depressed and unable to access their usual online activities. The father has three wives, who are biological sisters, and the girls' suicide note was addressed solely to him.

title: Who is van Schalkwyk: South Africa-born USA bowler who ran through India's batting
content: Shadley Claude van Schalkwyk delivered a stunning performance, taking three wickets in a single over against India in the T20 World Cup 2026 opener. The South African-born all-rounder dismissed Ishan Kishan, Tilak Varma, and Shivam Dube, leaving India reeling at 45 for 4 after the powerplay.

title: Happy Propose Day 2026: Quotes and message for your special someone
content: Valentine's Week continues with Propose Day, a time for expressing affection.  Struggling for the right words? This guide offers 50 sweet, funny, and movie-inspired messages.

title: New draft I-T rules 2026 released: What common taxpayers should know
content: In her Union Budget 2026 speech on February 1, FM Nirmala Sitharaman had said, ‚ÄúThe simplified Income Tax Rules and Forms will be notified shortly, giving adequate time to taxpayers to acquaint themselves with its requirements. The forms have been redesigned such that ordinary citizens can comply without difficulty.‚Äù

title: Thunder vs Rockets Feb 7, 2026: Watch Info, Lineups, Injuries & Prediction
content: The Houston Rockets visit the Oklahoma City Thunder on Saturday for their third matchup this season. The Thunder, despite recent losses and key player absences including Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, hold a strong home record. The Rockets, coming off a loss to Charlotte, aim to improve their road performance in this Western Conference clash.

title: T20 WC: Hetmyer scripts history, achieves this feat against Scotland
content: Shimron Hetmyer's explosive 64 off 36 balls powered West Indies to 182 for 5 against Scotland. Despite a shaky start and Scotland's disciplined bowling, Hetmyer's rapid counterattack, including a 81-run partnership with Rovman Powell, secured a competitive total.  His fastest T20 World Cup fifty for West Indies highlighted his improved fitness and clear batting approach.

title: The 50: Archana Gautam and Rajat Dalal get into a fight after latter calls her ‚ÄòDogla‚Äô
content: In a dramatic moment on 'The 50', reality TV icon Archana Gautam clashed with Rajat Dalal, who dared to disrespect her. In response, Archana made it clear that she will not tolerate such behavior. She has often reflected on how the intense demands of the show resonate with her fearless spirit and her tireless commitment to excellence.

title: Torch, meet Zlatan: Milan legend serves as Olympic torchbearer
content: former internazionale and AC Milan player Zlatan Ibrahimovic carried the Olympic Torch through the streets of Milan . he spent nine illustrious years with the two Milanese clubs, scoring 133 goals . his career took him everywhere from MLS to MLS ' LA Galaxy' before retiring in 2023 .

title: 'Still a chance': Lindsey Vonn is ready for the 2026 Olympics

title: Family affair: Jets hire Seth Ryan, source says
content: Frank Reich, 31, was hired as their new passing-game coordinator . he replaces Scott Turner, who was fired two weeks ago . this is a rarity in the NFL: three generations of a coaching family with one franchise .
